section.title: Removing a Ceph RADOS Gateway Node

abstract.para: Steps for removing Ceph RADOS Gateway nodes.The process to remove Ceph RADOS Gateway nodes depends on how they have been deployed. The Ceph Rados Gateway service can be installed in one of the following modes:

listitem.para: On dedicated cluster nodes (default) - Removal of a RADOS Gateway node is only supported when it is installed on a dedicated cluster node.

On (dedicated) cluster node(s) that host Ceph Monitor service - When installed in this mode, you must remove both the RADOS Gateway and Monitor using the procedure mentioned . You cannot remove RADOS Gateway node alone.
On controller nodes - When installed in this mode, the removal of the RADOS Gateway is not supported.

sidebar.title: Removing the Node from Monitoring
sidebar.para: Once you have removed the Rados Gateway node, the alarm against them will trigger, which requires you to perform additional steps to resolve it.

You must SSH to each of the Monasca API servers and edit the /etc/monasca/agent/conf.d/host_alive.yaml file to remove references to the Rados Gateway node that has been removed. This requires sudo access.
After removal of the Rados Gateway references on each of your Monasca API servers, restart the monasca-agent on each of those servers with the following command:

With the Rados Gateway node references removed and the monasca-agent restarted, you can then delete the corresponding alarm to finish this process. For this purpose, you are recommend to use the Monasca CLI, which should be installed on each of your Monasca API servers by default:
sidebar.screen: monasca alarm-list --metric-name host_alive_status --metric-dimensions hostname=<ceph monitor node deleted>
